p: Adult female Wistar rats (180 to 230 g) are used for testing anti-inflammatory activity and acute toxicity. The animals are reared in the Animal Center of the Faculty of Medicine and Pharmacy of Mohammed V University in Rabat, under standard experimental conditions, where the temperature varies between 20 and 25°C with a 12-hour photoperiodic cycle. The study was conducted in accordance with the accepted principles set out in the report “Guide for the care and use of laboratory animals” prepared by the National Academy of Sciences and published by the National Institutes of Health [ 17].
